name: Perfect Mashed Potatoes
ingredients: 4 large Potatoes, peeled and medium diced (don't cut to small)
8oz heavy whipping cream, heated (simmer and boil)
4oz milk, heated (can use buttermilk -­‐ he doesn't love milk)
1. Place the potatoes in a large stock pot
2. Cover the potatoes with COLD water
3. Using kosher salt, salt the cold water until the water is lightly salted like sea water
4. Cook the potatoes until soft over moderate heat until tender in the center
5. Drain the potatoes in a colander and return the stock pot to the stove
6. Warm the cream, the milk and the butter in the stock pot
7. In a large bowl, begin to mash the potatoes incorporating the cream and butter mixture as you go.
8. Adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper. Remember that the potatoes are already salted so taste them
steps: Ample water -­‐ 1 1/2 times the amount of potatoes.
Substitute buttermilk for the cream in this recipe for a lower fat, lower caloric version of these potatoes.
Add 2 Tablespoons of grated horseradish to the butter/cream/milk mixture and allow to simmer and then
incorporate this mixture into the potatoes for a lightly zested horseradish mashed potato, perfect to pair
